description.narrative: Distribution of food (rice, lentils, corn flour, pasta, vegetable oil, sugar and iodized salt), mattresses (1 per family), and sheets (1 set per family)

The second raining season of the year have been affected the department of Magdalena. Heavy raining in the Sierra Nevada of Santa Marta has caused the overflow of rivers Fundacion, and Aracataca. As a result of this situation, flooding has been reported in the municipalities of Fundación, Aracataca, and El Reten on October 29th.
According to the preliminary census done by the Disaster Risk Management Departamental Council, (CDGRD), (Consejo Departamental de Gestión del Riesgo de Desastre), in the municipality of Fundacion, 10.000 people have been affected by flooding in 16 neighborhoods. Including Ariguaní, Las Tablitas, Chimila, La Magdalena and Paz del Río where the river water got into the houses and the local market was totally flooded.[Footnote]
The flooding of Fundacion River also affected the rural municipalities of Aracata, especially Buenos Aires, Sampués, Sampuesito and Villa María. According to Mr. Eduardo Vélez, director of the Magdalena department Civil Defense, the most critical situation was reported last Monday in the municipality of El Reten affecting 10 neighborhoods.
The Mayor of Fundación municipality Mr. John Vargas, expressed that this is the worst river flooding since 1978 and that 60% of the municipality is totally flooded. “Only in Fundacion, we are talking about 5.000 people affected. The neighborhoods of 27 de febrero, San Miguel, San Isidro, El Ají, el Polideportivo, Campo Murcia, are flooded. This situation has been very hard for us” said vargas.
In El Retén, two provisional shelters have been set benefiting 300 families with humanitarian aid.
The governor of Magdalena, Rosa Cotes visited the affected families and started protection activities for the population at risk for prevention and attention of possible damage caused by the heavy raining. [Footnote]
